Name: Quaternion of Augustus
Description: Quaternion of Augustus. Anverse: uncovered head of Augustus on the right; in the neck area, a Capricorn. Reverse: hippopotamus on the right. Mintages position: 12.00 hours. This unique specimen was minted in the year 27 B.C, at the exact date on which Octavian received the title of Augustus in commemoration of the conquest of Egypt, won as a result of the battle of Actium and the subsequent taking of Alexandria in 30 B.C.
